column5: did i here that there is a big fire on or around gullrock lake does anyone have any info about this if so please do tell thanks fish bookie
Not according to this website.......http://forest.lrc.gov.on.ca/AFFM/fir...ap_English.htm Where are you getting your information????
one of my customers told me that today i'm not sure ware he herd it so thats why i'm asking I don't want to sound any alarms off but I thought i'd ask thanks moondog i'll check the website

They have had a huge fire threat all summer up there. Depends on time and weather you MAY see/get some smoke on gull rock. I know when we were up there in July we were only people in camp but there were pilots and cooks and fire fighters stayin in camp that week.Looks like some good rain keep the lightning out they should be good!

The number of fires in Ontario is less than half of what it was a few weeks ago. There is a big fire, Red 84, about 60 miles east, and another, Red 124, about 50 miles WNW, so depending on wind direction there could be days where you would have smoke on Gull Rock or any other lake in the Ear Falls/Red Lake area.
I assume there is an open fire ban up in this area. Can anyone confirm this?

Hello Pat Restricted Fire Zone Lifted in Northwestern Ontario The Ministry of Natural Resources has lifted a Restricted Fire Zone in Northwestern Ontario. The fire ban has been in place for several weeks due to an extreme fire hazard. However, the MNR is now confident that the situation has improved and the RFZ has been lifted effective immediately. It's raining & ovecast today. Fishing has been good on Gullrock Lake.
any size to the fish that your catching? we are up on the 10th or a good color that is working for you
